citation.article-title: Reclassification of the polyphyletic genus Prosthecomicrobium to form two novel genera, Vasilyevaea gen. nov. and Bauldia gen. nov. with four new combinations: Vasilyevaea enhydra comb. nov., Vasilyevaea mishustinii comb. nov., Bauldia consociata comb. nov. and Bauldia litoralis comb. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Bauldia (Baul′di.a. N.L. fem. n. Bauldia of Bauld, named in honour of John Bauld, an Australian microbiologist who isolated, investigated and named members of the genus Prosthecomicrobium and Planctomyces maris).
Gram-negative, budding prosthecate bacteria with numerous short appendages, less than 0.65 μm in length, extending from the cell surface.
Various carbon sources can be used for growth including some mono- and disaccharides and organic acids.
Found in brackish water and soil habitats.
The type species is Bauldia litoralis.
